title: IT Operations Manager
description:
**Company Description**
 For more than 70 years, IDB Bank has made it our mission to be the best bank for our clients by putting their needs first, and the success we’ve enjoyed fundamentally comes down to our people. Here at IDB, you’ll work side by side with some of the most talented professionals in the industry who share a strong sense of teamwork and a passion for providing exceptional service down to the smallest detail. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous paid time off and the ability to participate in our medical coverage and 401(k) plan on your very first day with us. We are also committed to diversity and inclusion, and to providing all of our team members with an equal opportunity to succeed and make meaningful contributions within a work environment that is respectful, welcoming and inclusive.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Bank is seeking a qualified individual to join its team its IT Team as Operations Manager. The Operations Manager serves as the team leader and IT’s primary point of contact for the bank’s suite of enterprise business applications with overall responsibility for those applications and their availability, daily production support, end\-of\-day processing, and support of the end\-users. Additionally, the role will also have responsibility for IT Asset Management and ServiceNow which is our IT Operations platform. This challenging role requires a combination of strong management skills, banking application knowledge, strong analytic and problem solving skills, technical acumen, project management experience, and excellent communication skills. This is a key and highly visible role with interaction across all levels and areas of the company.
   

  

**Primary Responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain a solid knowledge of the broad suite of business applications, surrounding business functions, technical architecture, and application interfaces.
* Manage a team of Application Managers who have direct responsibility for a set of production applications and who also
+ Manage vendor relationships
+ Stay aware of vendor product strategy, coming features, risks, issues
+ Provide 2nd line support to end\-users
+ Oversee application upgrades and patches

* Manage the Production Support Team that has responsibility for the bank’s end\-of\-day processes and technical support
* ServiceNow technical team with overall responsibility for the platform
* Oversee the IT Asset Management function and ensure a sound design and build\-out of the needed capabilities
* Active participation in IT Incidence and Change Management process
* Production process automation. Develop an understanding of in\-house process automation tools and identify opportunities to gain efficiencies through automation in IT and in the business units
* Provide guidance to the technical staff
* Provide subject matter expertise to strategic projects
* Assist strategic project teams with the creation of use cases and integration testing (pre\-UAT)
* Participate in technical design sessions \& Architecture Review Board sessions
* Proactively monitor for system issues and adherence to configurations standards. Lead issue resolution including reconciliation activities and data analysis and provide guidance to technical staff and business personnel
* Prepare the IT Annual Budget (BAU) in coordination with IT Senior Management \& the IT Finance team


**Qualifications**
* 10\+ years IT experience in the banking/finance industry highly preferred.
* Functional knowledge of Commercial Banking, including products focused on Deposits, Lending, Payments \& Investments strongly desired
* Experience with Commercial Banking Technical applications like Core Banking (Jack Henry, Fiserv, FIS), Lending (Loan IQ, Stucky) \& Payments (Payment Gateways, ACH/Wires/Swift)
* Experience working with ServiceNow
* Excellent project management and business analysis skills, knowledge of waterfall and agile
* Outstanding organizational and leadership skills with an ability to drive issues to consensus while promoting a positive collaborative environment
* Ability to build strong relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels
* Heavy experience with applications support, systems integration, data conversions, file transfers, and applications installation, configuration, upgrades, and managing IT assets, preferably in a banking
* Strong understanding of technologies such as databases, operating systems, networks, coding practices, and cloud
* Excellent analytical skills with the ability to lead troubleshooting initiatives and guide staff
* Experience managing vendor relationships and negotiating
* Ability to work effectively under pressure and to tight deadlines
* Willingness to take ownership and accountability
* Familiarity with market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Moody’s, and S\&P, with protocols such as FIX are a plus
* Experience with financial regulatory standards preferred


**Compensation:**
 The expected annual salary for this position is between $170,000 \- $200,000 at the start of employment. A salary offer is determined on an individualized basis, taking into consideration factors such as an individual’s skills and experience. In addition to base salary, our total rewards package also includes eligibility for an annual bonus, medical, pharmacy, dental, and vision plans, life and disability insurance, employee wellness program, retirement and savings plans with employer contributions, generous holiday and paid time off schedules, parental leave, and tuition reimbursement.
   

  

 Additional Information
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.
   

  

 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
   

  

 The Bank will make reasonable accommodations to the following employees to allow them to perform the essential functions of their position, except where doing so would result in undue hardship to the Bank:
   

  

* Those with a known mental or physical disability.
* Pregnant individuals and/or individuals with pregnancy or childbirth\-related medical conditions.
* Victims of domestic violence, sex offenses or stalking.
* Employees with religious observance and practice obligations.


 Any employee who believes he or she needs an accommodation for any of the above reasons should contact their supervisor or a member of Human Resources to request such an accommodation. In each case, the Bank will engage in a good faith written or oral dialogue concerning the individual’s accommodation needs; potential accommodations that may address the individual’s accommodation needs, including alternatives to a requested accommodation; and the difficulties that such potential accommodations may pose for the employer.
   

  

 The Bank retains the ultimate discretion to choose the appropriate reasonable accommodation. Upon reaching a final determination at the conclusion of the cooperative dialogue, the Bank will provide the requesting individual with a written final determination identifying any accommodation granted or denied. In addition, the Bank will maintain any information regarding the employee’s request and status in the strictest confidence, except as requested by the employee, as required on a need\-to\-know basis or as otherwise required by law.
   

  

 IDB BANK, INCLUDING ITS SUBSIDIARIES AND DIVISIONS, PROVIDES EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES TO ALL EMPLOYEES AND APPLICANTS FOR EMPLOYMENT WITHOUT REGARD TO RACE, COLOR, RELIGION, SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, NATIONAL ORIGIN, AGE, DISABILITY, GENETIC STATUS, CITIZENSHIP STATUS, MARITAL STATUS, MILITARY OR VETERAN STATUS, CURRENT UNEMPLOYMENT OR ANY OTHER LEGALLY PROTECTED CATEGORY IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPLICABLE FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL LAW. NOTHING IN THIS SITE CONSTITUTES A PROMISE OR OFFER OF EMPLOYMENT.

title: IT Service Desk Lead
description:
As an IT Service Desk Lead at YouLend, you will be one of two regional leads responsible for delivering high\-quality IT support services to employees across our global operations. One role will be based in our London office and the other in our Atlanta office, providing geographic and time zone coverage to ensure continuity, resilience, and operational excellence.
   

  

 You will act as the regional escalation point for all end\-user IT support issues, lead by example in providing exceptional support, and work closely with peers and global IT leadership to maintain and continually improve our service delivery model. The role is pivotal in upholding YouLend's standards around IT security, access control, and operational alignment across regions.
   

  

**Requirements**
**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the delivery of IT support for your assigned region, including 1st/2nd line incident resolution, request fulfilment, and escalations
* Own regional IT onboarding/offboarding workflows in coordination with HR and Security
* Ensure timely and secure provisioning/deprovisioning of access in accordance with Joiner\-Mover\-Leaver processes
* Troubleshoot hardware, software, and network issues across Windows, macOS, iOS, and supported SaaS platforms
* Collaborate with your counterpart in the other region to ensure consistent user experience, knowledge sharing, and issue handover across time zones
* Enforce security policies and proactively identify and reduce instances of shadow IT
* Maintain and improve asset management practices, ensuring visibility of all regional devices and peripherals
* Support local office infrastructure (meeting room tech, printers, network equipment, etc.)
* Coordinate with third\-party vendors (e.g., Apple, Dell, Microsoft, OpenAI, CRM and Telephony partners) where required
* Proactively contribute to documentation, service improvement initiatives, automations, and toolset optimisation


**Essential Skills**
* Proven experience in IT support/service desk environments with ownership responsibilities
* Strong working knowledge of Microsoft 365, Entra ID, Windows and macOS environments
* Familiarity with MDM tools (Intune, Kandji), ITSM platforms, and ITIL\-aligned processes
* Excellent communication, customer service, and organisational skills
* Ability to work independently while staying aligned with a global team
* Experience supporting SaaS\-heavy environments (Slack, Atlassian, HubSpot, cloud telephony, etc.)
* A proactive, methodical approach to troubleshooting and documentation
* Experience supervising and developing more junior colleagues


**Benefits**
* Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental \& Vision)
* Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
* Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick \& Public Holidays)
* Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
* Training \& Development
* Free Food \& Snacks
* Wellness Resources

title: Vice President of Information Technology
description:
At Pacific Seafood, we do more than just provide the world with the healthiest proteins on the planet. We are an excellence\-driven organization committed to being the brand of choice in the marketplace and the employer of choice in the community. We believe in servant leadership, investing in our team members, and rewarding performance. We live by the core values of our Diamond Philosophy: Quality, Teamwork, Productivity, and Excellence—which means consistently doing your best and always striving to do better.
   

  

**Summary:**
 The VP of IT at Pacific Seafood is a member of the PSG Executive Leadership team, supporting efforts to create strategies and implement solutions that enable continual growth, expansion and optimize the company’s operational strategy while ensuring business continuity. This position involves being fiscally responsible, business\-oriented, strategic, and technical and is ideal for someone who is adept at building positive relationships across multiple departments, working collaboratively to communicate tasks, implement changes, improve business performance, and resolve issues. The VP of IT is responsible for building and maintaining sustainable systems which deliver the required information across the entire enterprise. The VP of IT leads the IT Department and is responsible for setting and implementing the strategic direction and effective implementation of flexible, scalable, and adaptable systems. This role is also responsible for all aspects of Cybersecurity as well as IT support.
   

  

 At a minimum, the following roles report to the VP of IT:
   

  

* Director of Network Infrastructure
* Director of DevOps
* Manager of Support
* Administrative Assistant


**Key Responsibilities:** 
**2\. Business Administration:** 
**3\. IT Specific Strategic Growth:** 
**4\. Financial Management:** 
**5\. Technical:** 
**6\. Leadership Team:**
* People Management:
* Provide strong leadership and vision to the IT team, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and excellence in execution.
* Identify gaps in the IT team, direct and oversee the recruitment, training, and development of IT staff, ensuring the team has the skills and resources needed to succeed.
* Conduct regular performance evaluations, provide constructive feedback, and support professional growth and career development within the team.
* Implement succession planning and talent management strategies to ensure the continuity and growth of the IT department.
* Challenge IT team members to frequently work collaboratively with technology consumers in all divisions.
* Oversee the daily operations of the IT department, including network management, development and/or systems administration of enterprise applications, cybersecurity, and helpdesk support.
* Ensure the availability, reliability, backup/recovery and security of IT systems and infrastructure.
* Develop and enforce IT policies, procedures, and standards to maintain data integrity, security, and compliance with regulations.
* Continually reach out to enterprise through customer satisfaction surveys and other means to verify that the department has a good understanding of areas where they can improve and how other employees view the service level of the IT team.
* Ensure that the IT team is effectively communicating with the rest of the enterprise.
* Develop a deep understanding of the Pacific Seafood strategic plan, business model and the multiple vertically integrated business units.
* Develop and maintain a multi\-year IT strategy/roadmap identifying key operational initiatives to optimize and drive efficiencies in the current business environment, in an atmosphere of cost consciousness, while allowing for substantial growth, change and innovation in the future.
* Oversee and effectively manage the global Pacific Seafood Information Technology portfolio.
* Successfully deliver all projects on time and on or below budget, ensuring that they meet or exceed the needs of the business.
* Oversee the management of risk related to business continuity planning, security, infrastructure, and crisis management.
* Develop and maintain strategic and tactically relevant partnerships with vendors that may help offer solutions based on specific company needs.
* Consistently updates the executive leadership team on the changes in industry trends. This includes planning, budgeting, purchasing and accounting solutions that will help further the strategic goals of Pacific Seafood Group.
* Research, propose and implement appropriate AI tools and methods of benefit to the company, with a particular emphasis on marketing
* Continuously seek ways to add value, provide security, and anticipate business/market changes by providing timely solutions for the company.
* Provide the necessary technology support to the financial management of the enterprise, including financial planning, budgeting, FP\&A and BI/Reporting.
* Develop, manage, and monitor the IT department’s budget, ensuring that financial resources are used efficiently and effectively.
* Analyze and report on IT expenditures, identifying opportunities for cost savings and optimizing resource allocation.
* Manage contracts with vendors and service providers to secure cost\-effective services without compromising quality.
* Lead financial negotiations for IT\-related purchases, contracts, and service agreements.
* Ensure the IT function meets industry standards in all areas. Seek outside expertise as necessary to identify gaps and consider recommendations.
* Identify, report and mitigate IT risks to the organization, including physical and cyber security, systems performance and availability, single points of failure, backup and recovery.
* Keep the IT function is up to date on technology and innovates to advance the company’s mission in a sustainable way.
* Work with functions being supported to ensure IT solutions adequately meet functional requirements and fit the function’s culture and necessary methods of operation.
* Maintain IT systems, whether on\-premises or hosted/cloud, with standardized solutions for hardware, servers and networks, and manage repair, upgrades and replacements on regular cycles.
* Identify and manage software update processes using internal and external resources. Collaborate with the organization to minimize operating impact and business risk.
* Maintain plans underlying the IT roadmap which define the scope, resources, timeline and budget for IT projects. Address MES/Automation needs and scope for R\&D vs. IT.
* Select, measure and manage contractors and vendors providing products and services to the IT mission.
* Manage IT projects using standardized, professional grade project management methods.
* Participate in Executive Leadership sessions including communicating and confirming IT strategy as well as supporting peer executives in their missions.
* Work collaboratively with the leadership team in all matters to act as a change agent across all functions.
* Stay up to date on the current tactical needs of each function being supported.
* Set IT strategy and make sure the leadership team understands the IT strategy, roadmap, and mission as it may evolve.
* Work with leadership to measure and report on the health and status of the IT function and to make tactical decisions affecting other functions.


**What you Bring to Pacific Seafood:**
***Required:***
* BA/BS degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Management, Engineering, or related field.
* 10\+ years of progressive Information Technology management/leadership experience.
* 3\+ years of experience in a similar role within a similar sized company with distributed locations and systems complexity
* Strong technical project management skills.
* Experience in systems analysis; people development
* Ability to travel up to 25% of the time or more, as required.


***Preferred:***
* Prior experience in e\-commerce, logistics, distribution and manufacturing technology solutions.
* Prior LEAN management and constant process improvement experience.
* Master’s degree in Business Administration is preferred.
* Food processing experience is a plus


**Pacific Seafood** 
 has retained Kincannon \& Reed to recruit a
 **Vice President of Information Technology** 
 .
   

  

**Total Compensation**
 At Pacific Seafood, your base wage is only a portion of your overall compensation package. We invest in our Team Members through a comprehensive and attractive total rewards package, including but not limited to:
   

  

* Health insurance benefits options, including medical, prescription, vision, dental, basic group life and short term disability.
* Flexible spending accounts for health flex and dependent care expenses.
* 401(k) Retirement Plan options with generous annual company profit sharing match.
* Paid time off for all regular FT team members, to include paid sick, vacation, holiday, and personal time.
* Employee Assistance Program\- Confidential professional counseling, financial, and legal assistance provided at no charge to Team Members and immediate family members
* Product purchase program.


 Pacific Seafood is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Vice President, IT Infrastructure & Operations
description:
Apogee Services Inc.
   

  

 Apogee Enterprises, Inc. (NASDAQ: APOG) was founded in 1949 and headquartered in Minneapolis, MN. Apogee is a growing, profitable company with annual revenues approaching $1\.5 billion. Apogee is a leading provider of architectural products and services for enclosing buildings, and high\-performance coated materials for a variety of applications, including décor, graphic design, and building products. To learn more about our brands visit www.apog.com.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 The Vice President (VP), Infrastructure \& Operations will develop and implement the strategy to modernize and maintain our IT infrastructure including network, device management and data centers, including IT service desk operations in support of a growth\-oriented organization. This role will collaborate with the IT senior leadership team to align IT initiatives with business objectives. The VP will build, lead, and mentor a high\-performing IT team, fostering a culture of accountability, customer focus, collaboration, and continuous improvement. This role is expected to drive adoption of emerging technologies and best practices to enhance efficiency, agility, and innovation as a trusted advisor to the IT senior leadership team on technology trends and opportunities.
   

  

 The successful candidate will be a leader with strong executive presence and a proven track record of building and scaling high performing technology solutions to drive growth. The leader will take a low ego, “roll up your sleeves” approach, combining technology expertise, business acumen, influencing skills and results\-orientation.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Infrastructure**
* Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of robust and scalable IT infrastructure, including data centers, storage, backups, cloud platforms, networks, and servers.
* Ensures system reliability, availability, redundancy, and scalability to meet current and future business needs.
* Establishes Key Performance Indicators to measure, analyze and report to senior management on the effectiveness and performance of the infrastructure.


**Operations and Process Optimization**
* Directs the development and integration of new and innovative operations and/or services by providing leadership that maximizes the teams’ contributions and efficiency.
* Ensure IT infrastructure and operations comply with industry standards, regulations, and security best practices
* Collaborate with security teams to mitigate risks, manage vulnerabilities, and respond to cyber threats


**IT Operations**
* Lead IT operations, with accountability for incident management, change management, disaster recovery, and business continuity planning
* Establish and monitor KPI’s to measure and improve IT operational performance
* Oversee IT operations to drive standardization and automation of processes to improve customer focus, efficiency, and service delivery
* Inventory and document IT processes and establish a roadmap to optimize, streamline or automate. Maintain IT process framework and align operations processes and policies deployed through the Service Desk and Operations teams


**Service Desk**
* Design and deliver IT service desk shared services that enhance the internal user experience
* Establishes service level agreements for responsiveness


**Budget And Vendor/Supplier Management**
* Develop and manage the IT infrastructure and operations budget, optimizing investments for maximum impact and efficiency.
* Negotiate and manage vendor contracts with Procurement resources, ensuring cost\-effective and high\-quality service delivery.


**Personal Attributes**
**Skills**
 The successful candidate will be expected to be a high\-energy, creative, and resourceful self\-starter who demonstrates leadership skills and instincts. He/she is highly intelligent and enthusiastic with a commitment to excellence. In terms of personal competencies, the successful candidate must be a hands\-on person who possesses the best combination of strategic thinking and drive to achieve tangible business results. In addition, he/she should possess the following competencies:
   

  

* Ethics: Highest level of professional integrity and honesty as well as personal credibility.
* Functional Leadership: A confident, mature person with the ability to connect and inspire others. A proven track record of leading projects and teams that successfully achieve milestones and complete deliverables. Experience managing in an environment that continuously prioritizes operational excellence.
* Results\-Oriented: A driver who possesses the ability to take actions and implement effective solutions in a timely manner often while influencing across different functions and levels of the organization.
* Problem Solver: A creative yet pragmatic problem solver who can anticipate potential challenges and proactively address to remove barriers to progress. Methodical and hands\-on as well as detail oriented. Strong analytical skills.
* Change Management. Exposure to significant enterprise level change. Demonstrated ability to operate within a team environment, and highly dynamic situations. Has an 80/20 sense of what matters and can manage complexity and build consensus through strong collaboration.
* Teamwork and Interpersonal Skills: A team player and builder, receptive to ideas from others. Shares information and keeps team members and partners informed. Works effectively with others to identify and resolve issues. Excellent interpersonal skills and an ability to interact successfully with all levels of management as well as a diverse work force. Ability to understand and add value to high\-level management interactions.


**Education And Skills Required**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field; a Master’s degree or MBA is preferred
* 15\+ years of experience in IT, with at least 10 years in a leadership role
* Demonstrated experience in mergers and acquisitions, from due diligence to integration and synergy attainment.
* Strong talent management skills including strategic workforce planning, talent development, coaching, mentoring, and team motivation.
* Strong organizational skills, including an ability to perform under pressure and manage multiple priorities with competing demands for resources.
* Ability to perform duties and responsibilities in a manner consistent with the company's values.


**Travel Requirements**
* Travel anticipated approximately 5\-10%


**Pay Range**

title: Director - Information Technology Services
description:
**Position Summary**
 Under the administrative direction of the City Manager, the Director – Information Technology Services is responsible for the administration, direction, and supervision of all Information Technology Services Department activities and employees, including all divisions. The Director – Information Technology Services manages the day\-to\-day operations of the Information Technology Department and interacts with all divisions in the assigned department as well as cross\-City departments. This position manages the daily operations of the network Security and plays a dual role as Chief Information Security Officer and Chief Information Officer.
   

  

 The Director – Information Technology Services plans, coordinates, manages, supervises, and oversees the activities and operations for administrative and/or technical operations of the Department through oral and written reports and personal observation, and heads major initiatives. The Director – Information Technology Services performs duties with considerable independence and latitude in supervising and in being responsible for technical and administrative operations of the Department in accordance with municipal policies, rules, and regulations. Work is evaluated through conferences and review of progress reports. The City Manager may delegate supervisory authority to an Assistant City Manager.
   

  

**Compensation \& Benefits**
 The City of Fort Lauderdale offers a competitive salary depending on qualifications and experience. The salary is negotiable, but the pay range is $126,835\.70 \- $228,693\.00 annually. The City provides a generous benefits program including health, dental, life insurance and paid vacation and sick leave. In addition to the competitive benefits package and salary, the City participates in the Florida Retirement System (FRS) which offers an investment option and a pension option and requires a 3% contribution from employees. The City also contributes on behalf of the employee at a rate established by the State of Florida. New hires are automatically enrolled in FRS.
   

  

* Residence requirement for department directors: Any person appointed by the city manager to the position of department director or department head shall, within six (6\) months from the date of such appointment, establish residence and reside during such employment within the corporate limits; provided, however, such requirement is not applicable to any employee promoted and appointed to such position by the city manager. The city manager may extend the time period set forth above if it is determined that the appointee is experiencing financial difficulty in meeting the requirements of this section.


**Please Note: This is a non\-classified, "at will" position and not subject to Civil Service Rules or any collective bargaining agreement. This job classification is in Management Category I for benefits purposes.**
**Essential Job Functions**
 Essential functions are the basic job duties that an employee must be able to perform, with or without reasonable accommodation. The list of essential functions, as outlined herein, is intended to be representative of the tasks performed within this classification. The omission of a function does not preclude management from assigning essential duties not listed herein if such duties relate to the position.
   

  

* Manages the work of assigned personnel; delegates and reviews work assignments; hires, trains, and evaluates employees.
* Prepares standard operating procedures for department divisions; performs strategic planning for overall improvement of department services; evaluates service areas for deficiencies, formulates solutions, and develops action plans.
* Interacts and coordinates with all divisions and other Departments in the City.
* Analyzes complex business needs presented by the user community and boards; recommends technical solutions.
* Develops plans for the implementation of new projects; coordinates with project managers to ensure optimum allocation and utilization of technology resources.
* Maintains awareness of changing IT and Security trends and state regulations/ city ordinances which might impact the city; takes corrective action as required.
* Authorizes and oversees the deployment, monitoring, maintenance, development, and support of all hardware and software based on city\-wide needs.
* Develops and reviews performance benchmarks for all divisions of information technology; implements and monitors controls to ensure the standards are maintained or exceeded.
* Evaluates business needs, objectives, and goals; researches available products; designates procedures to best meet those needs as a system.
* Directs research on potential technology solutions and implementations in support of new city initiatives, opportunities and procurement efforts, including internal cost\-cutting initiatives and programs.
* Serves as Chief Information Security Officer for City; ensures the security of the city\-wide network; provides staff with swift, accurate, and secure methods to access information.
* Establishes and implements security\-related policies; oversees regulatory compliance; ensures data privacy; manages the security incident response team for breeches.
* Performs related work as required.


**Minimum Job Requirements**
 JOB REQUIREMENTS, PREFERENCES \& WORK ENVIRONMENT
   

  

* Graduated from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Eight (8\) plus years of progressively responsible professional and managerial level experience in facilitating an IT Department with responsibilities managing an Information Security Division within a government agency.
* Previous supervisory experience required.
* Additional qualifying experience may substitute on a year\-for\-year basis for the required education.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Certifications in the following: PMP, ITIL, Lean Six Sigma, Agile, Business Relationship Management, Customer Experience and other related project and/or service related disciplines.
* Experience managing an IT Department of at least 20 to 30 employees.
* Department budget forecasting experience.
* Experience identifying opportunities for improvement and leading initiatives using IT in new and innovative ways to bring value to the business and drive the business forward.


**Special Requirements**
* As a member of the Executive Strategy Team (EST), this position is expected to maintain presence at the Emergency Operations Center (EOC) during declared emergencies.
* This position is deemed security sensitive and will require a post conditional offer in\-depth employment background investigation.


**Physical Standards Required To Perform Essential Job Functions**
 The position is generally sedentary. Employee will sit most of the time, but may walk or stand for brief periods of time.
   

  

 The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
   

  

**How To Apply \& Supplemental Information**
 Applicants who qualify will be subject to an extensive selection process and screening program, which may include, but not be limited to evaluation of training and experience; written test; interview; employment record, background check; medical examination; and drug screen. The expected duration of the selection process varies by position.
   

  

 The City of Fort Lauderdale is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action, inclusive employer and a Drug Free Workplace. The City of Fort Lauderdale does not discriminate based on age, citizenship status, color, disability, marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, or sexual orientation. Veterans' preference per Florida law.
   

  

 The City of Fort Lauderdale offers a comprehensive benefits package to all regular full\-time employees including vacation, holiday, and sick leave as well as medical, dental, vision, life and short\-term disability insurance.
   

  

 Click here for an overview of employment information including our benefits package.
   

  

**Click Here For Additional Management Benefits.**
**Say "Hello" to the City of Fort Lauderdale and Say "Goodbye" to Your Student Loan! Under the U.S. Department of Education's Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) program, the remaining balance on your student loan may be forgiven after you have made 120 qualifying monthly payments while working full\-time at the City of Fort Lauderdale! Click here for more information or to see if you qualify.
   

  

 In addition to the competitive benefits package and salary, the City of Fort Lauderdale participates in the Florida Retirement System (FRS) which offers an investment option and a pension option and requires a 3% contribution from employees. All new City of Fort Lauderdale employees are automatically enrolled in FRS. Click here to view additional information on the Florida Retirement System.**

title: Vice President Information Technology
description:
**Vice President of IT** 




 📍
 *Philadelphia, PA* 
 (Hybrid: 3 Days Onsite)
 



  





**About the Opportunity:** 




**Career Staffing Talent (CST)** 
 is partnering with a prominent law firm to hire a
 **Vice President of IT** 
 . This executive\-level role will lead and scale enterprise\-wide technology operations, overseeing a high\-performing team of 30\+ professionals spanning infrastructure, application development, cybersecurity, and service delivery. The ideal candidate will be a strategic, user\-centric leader capable of aligning IT operations with business objectives in a fast\-paced legal environment.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* Lead IT operations across infrastructure, enterprise applications, software development, business systems, and IT service management.
* Ensure system reliability, performance, security, and scalability to support business growth and continuity.
* Analyze user feedback and satisfaction metrics to continuously improve the end\-user experience.

* Ensure compliance with global data security and privacy standards (ISO 27001, SOC, HIPAA, GDPR); support incident response readiness.

* Flexibility for off\-hours work as needed to meet operational priorities.

title: Manager, IT Service Center
description:
**CULTIVATE A BETTER WORLD** 




  





 Food served fast does not have to be a typical fast\-food experience. Chipotle has always done things differently, both in and out of our restaurants. We are changing the face of fast food, starting conversations, and directly supporting efforts to shift the future of farming and food. We hope you will join us as we continue to learn, evolve, and shape what comes next on our mission to make better food accessible to everyone.
 



  





**THE OPPORTUNITY** 




  





 As the Manager, IT Service Center (ITSC) you are responsible for ensuring the timely and accurate delivery of Tier 1 technical support services to 3800\+ restaurants in the U.S., Canada, and Europe. You will manage an external 3rd party contact center ensuring key performance indicators and service level agreements are met. You will also lead a small team of internal employees, ensuring that staffing, processes, training, knowledge, and tools are aligned to meet business needs.
 



  





**WHAT YOU’LL DO** 



* Direct remote contact center partner operations, perpetuating a vision consistent with Chipotle’s values.
* Manage BPO performance by setting expectations, review of results and progress planning, including daily review of dashboards and performance reports.
* Regularly leading progress reviews and calibration meetings with 3rd party leadership, promptly communicating any identified performance issues or trends.
* Works with 3rd party leadership to develop swift improvement plans to address performance gaps, regularly reports performance progress to senior leadership.
* Monitor performance metrics to ensure consistent service delivery that meets or exceeds defined standards.
* Drive customer satisfaction through timely and accurate issue resolution; remediate customer escalations, as needed.
* Manage all aspects of IT Service Center operations and support functions.
* Assure agent preparedness in a continuously changing restaurant technology environment.
* Improve delivered business value over time by refining policies, procedures, and processes.
* Research and recommend improvements to mitigate service level risks and optimize service level processes.
* Facilitate the deployment of new contact center technology.
* Partner with internal and external stakeholders to ensure the best experience is provided



  





**WHAT YOU’LL BRING TO THE TABLE** 



* B.A./B.S. in a related field, or an equivalent in education and experience.
* 5\-8 years’ technical support experience, preferably in the restaurant/retail industry, utilizing knowledge of systems design, systems integration, maintenance, and troubleshooting.
* 3\-5 years’ supervisory experience including experience managing an external vendor.
* IT Incident management experience including handling major outages.
* Proficient using ServiceNow, Five9, Verint or similar tools.



  





  





**PAY TRANSPARENCY** 




  





 A reasonable estimate of the current base pay range for this position is $98,000\.00–$137,000\.00\. You are also eligible for annual cash bonuses and equity awards based upon performance and other factors. Actual compensation offered may vary depending on skill level, experience, and/or education. Chipotle offers a competitive total rewards package, which includes medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401k, sick leave, vacation time, and much more. Visit https://jobs.chipotle.com/benefits for more details.
 



  





**WHO WE ARE** 




  





 Chipotle Mexican Grill, Inc. (NYSE: CMG) is cultivating a better world by serving responsibly sourced, classically cooked, real food with wholesome ingredients without artificial colors, flavors or preservatives. Chipotle has restaurants in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, France and Germany and is the only restaurant company of its size that owns and operates all its restaurants in North America and Europe. With employees passionate about providing a great guest experience, Chipotle is a longtime leader and innovator in the food industry. Chipotle is committed to making its food more accessible to everyone while continuing to be a brand with a demonstrated purpose as it leads the way in digital, technology and sustainable business practices. For more information or to place an order online, visit WWW.CHIPOTLE.COM
 



  





*Chipotle Mexican Grill is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. As a people\-first company rooted in values, our purpose extends beyond serving nutritious food using real ingredients. It means hiring world\-class individuals and fostering a culture that champions diversity, ensures equity, and celebrates inclusion. All qualified applicants, regardless of personal characteristics, are encouraged to apply.* 




  





*Qualified applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and/or certain state or local laws. Please contact
 
 ADAaccommodations@chipotle.com
 
 if you need an accommodation due to a disability to complete an application, job interview, and/or to otherwise participate in the hiring process. This email does not respond to non\-accommodations related requests.*

title: Vice President of IT
description:
**About Us**
 Empower Brands was founded in 2022 as a product of the integration of Lynx Franchising and Outdoor Living Brands. Empower encompasses ten industry\-leading brands across commercial and residential services: JAN\-PRO, FRSTeam, Archadeck Outdoor Living, Outdoor Lighting Perspectives (OLP), Conserva Irrigation, Koala Insulation, Wallaby Windows, Superior Fence and Rail, Bumble Roofing and Canopy Lawn Care. Empower is dedicated to providing its customers with the highest quality products and services in the commercial and home services industry while simultaneously delivering its franchise owners committed personal support, tools and empowerment to pursue their own success. Empower Brands is a portfolio company of MidOcean Partners, a leading private equity firm with an excellent track record investing in successful, growth\-focused franchise businesses. For more about Empower Brands, visit the company’s website at EmpowerFranchising.com.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 This is a key leadership role that will require both technical expertise and the ability to collaborate with senior executives across all departments. The Vice President of IT will play a critical role in driving Empower’s technology strategy forward, ensuring efficient IT operations, and leading cross\-functional teams in various high\-impact areas. This leadership role requires a seasoned IT professional with expertise in helpdesk management, overseeing complex IT projects, guiding product development and ownership, enhancing cybersecurity measures, and leveraging AI and data warehouses to improve organizational efficiency and decision\-making.
   

  

**Key Areas Of Responsibility**
**Strategic Technology Planning:**
* Drive the strategic direction of IT, aligning technology initiatives with the organization’s overall business goals.
* Develop and execute the IT strategy aligned with the organization’s business objectives and growth vision.
* Lead the IT department, including recruitment, mentoring, and developing a high\-performing team.
* Collaborate with other executives to ensure IT supports business needs and drives innovation.
* Continuously assess and integrate new technologies to improve operational efficiency, scalability, and innovation.


**Team Leadership \& Development**
* Build, mentor, and lead a high\-performing IT team, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement.
* Evaluate team performance and provide coaching and development opportunities to grow talent within the department.
* Oversight of Cybersecurity, Help Desk Operations, and Data Warehousing teams to ensure IT teams are delivering technology related needs to both internal and external customers


**Project Management \& IT Initiatives**
* Oversee and manage IT projects, ensuring they are delivered on time, within budget, and meet business objectives.
* Work closely with other departments to understand their technological needs and develop project plans accordingly.
* Establish clear project timelines, KPIs, and risk management strategies to mitigate potential issues. Function as the product owner for key IT\-driven products and services, ensuring alignment with business goals.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define product vision, features, and requirements.
* Collaborate with development teams to ensure product delivery aligns with customer and business needs.
* Lead the development and implementation of a robust cybersecurity strategy to protect the company’s digital assets and data.
* Ensure compliance with industry regulations and standards (e.g., GDPR, CCPA, etc.).
* Stay ahead of evolving cyber threats and work to safeguard the organization’s infrastructure and data


**Cybersecurity**
**Product Ownership \& Development:**
**AI \& Data Warehousing**
* Lead initiatives to implement AI solutions and machine learning algorithms that can enhance business operations and decision\-making.
* Oversee the management and optimization of data warehouses, ensuring the organization can leverage data for insightful analytics.
* Collaborate with data teams to ensure data governance, quality, and accessibility standards are upheld.


**IT Operations \& Infrastructure**
* Oversee the architecture, design, and implementation of IT systems, networks, and platforms.
* Ensure the smooth operation of all IT infrastructure, ensuring maximum uptime, scalability, and reliability.
* Manage IT budgets, resources, and priorities to optimize costs and efficiencies.
* Negotiate contracts and manage relationships with third\-party vendors and service providers.
* Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of IT initiatives.
* Report on IT performance, projects, and risks to senior management and the board of directors.


**Qualifications**
* 10\+ years of experience successfully leading IT teams and driving technology strategy in a dynamic business environment.
* Player Coach Mentality – must be a leader who is prepared to get their hands dirty as and when needed taking a collaborative approach to problem solving. Must be comfortable pivoting from board level discussions down to in\-depth technological discussions at a moment’s notice.
* Deep understanding of IT service management (ITSM) best practices and helpdesk operations.
* Experience managing complex IT projects, with demonstrated success in delivering on time and within scope.
* Exceptional leadership, management, and mentoring skills, with the ability to inspire and lead cross\-functional teams.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to influence and collaborate at all levels of the organization.
* Experience in either software development or having dealt with external software development resources with an understanding of VB.net and MS Access
* Excellent problem\-solving and decision\-making abilities, especially under pressure.
* Strong background in cybersecurity principles, tools, and risk management.
* Knowledge of AI technologies, machine learning, and data analytics with the ability to translate them into actionable business strategies.
* Expertise in data warehousing and business intelligence platforms.
* Excellent communication, leadership, and people skills with the ability to work collaboratively with cross\-functional teams.
* A strategic thinker who can balance day\-to\-day operations with long\-term technology planning, including experience managing and prioritizing multiple key initiatives and projects in alignment with Senior Leadership Teams
* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
* Ability to travel up to 20% of the time for business needs, including site visits, meetings with key stakeholders, vendor management, and conferences. Some international travel may be required.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in multi\-brand, multi\-entity franchising or general franchising experience preferred
* Experience with digital transformation, cloud migration, or enterprise architecture.
* Knowledge of industry\-specific regulations, compliance requirements, and best practices.
* Certifications such as PMP, CISSP, or other relevant IT management certifications.


**Note**
 This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job\-related instructions and to perform any other job\-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments. All duties and responsibilities are essential functions and requirements and are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. To perform this job successfully, the incumbents will possess the skills, aptitudes, and abilities to perform each duty proficiently. Some requirements may exclude individuals who pose a direct threat or significant risk to the health or safety of themselves or others. The requirements listed in this document are the minimum levels of knowledge, skills, or abilities. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an “at will” relationship.
   

  

*Empower Brands is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.
   

  

 This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Empower Brands makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.*

title: IT Director
description:
**Overview:**
 We are seeking an experienced and visionary IT Director to join our team at Centre Technologies, a leading Managed Service Provider (MSP). The IT Director will oversee the strategic direction and management of our IT department, ensuring the delivery of high\-quality services to our clients. This role requires a strategic thinker with exceptional leadership skills and a deep understanding of IT infrastructure, service management, and business alignment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Strategic Leadership: Develop and implement the overall IT strategy aligned with business goals. Drive innovation and continuous improvement in IT services
* Department Oversight: Oversee the IT department, including IT Managers and other senior staff. Ensure effective management and coordination of all IT functions
* Client Engagement: Establish and maintain strong relationships with key clients. Act as a senior point of contact for major client issues and strategic discussions
* Executive Collaboration: Work closely with the executive team to align IT initiatives with organizational objectives. Provide insights and recommendations to support business growth
* Resource Allocation: Manage the allocation of resources across various IT projects and initiatives. Ensure optimal utilization of personnel, budget, and technology
* Risk Management: Identify and mitigate risks associated with IT operations and projects. Implement robust security measures and ensure compliance with industry standards
* Performance Monitoring: Establish metrics and KPIs to monitor the performance of IT services. Ensure high levels of client satisfaction and service delivery
* Technology Roadmap: Develop and maintain a technology roadmap that supports the company's strategic goals. Evaluate emerging technologies and their potential impact on the business
* Budget Oversight: Oversee the IT budget, including planning, forecasting, and cost control. Ensure efficient use of financial resources
* Vendor Management: Manage relationships with key vendors and service providers. Negotiate contracts and ensure the delivery of high\-quality services


**Qualifications:**
* Education: Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field. Master's degree preferred
* Experience: Minimum of 10 years of experience in IT management, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role within an MSP environment
* Skills: Strong strategic thinking and leadership skills. Proficiency in IT infrastructure management, project management, and service delivery. Knowledge of cybersecurity best practices


**What Sets You Apart: Soft Skills and Client Experience**
 At Centre Technologies, technical skills are just the beginning. We're looking for an IT Director who builds trust through transparency, takes initiative, and leads with accountability. You should be passionate about both technology and people—committed to delivering exceptional, personalized service that reflects our core values.
   

  

 Success in this role means:
   

  

* Building strong, honest client partnerships
* Driving outcomes with ownership and professionalism
* Leading with a customer\-first mindset and a collaborative approach
* Delivering scalable, secure solutions with a local, personalized touch


 If you're service\-driven, relationship\-focused, and thrive on doing things the right way — you'll feel right at home here.
   

  

 Powered by JazzHR

title: Vice President Information Technology
description:
**Vice President Information Technology (US\-O)**
 Would you like to join the Logistics Company for the World? DHL Supply Chain is just that.
   

  

 Become an essential part of everyday life, by contributing to an organization that is Connecting People and Improving Lives. If you have a passion for people, a desire to problem\-solve, and eagerness to pursue continuous improvement opportunities… we look forward to exploring career possibilities with you!
   

  

**Job Description**
* Leads long\-term IT priorities for DHL Supply Chain’s North America – Life Sciences and Health Care (LSHC) business unit (BU).Aligns IT strategy to business unit strategy enabling sustainable growth and profitability

Further, IT Project Management compliance with global methodology and the use of standard Project Delivery documents and tools

 The VP IT role has accountability of the following…
   

  

  

* IT project implementations in the support of BU new business pursuits and existing BU operations improvements

Planning for recruiting, hiring and onboarding new roles as well as developing current staff/team to meet the demands for the future

 Customers, Suppliers \& Stakeholders

* Negotiates critical targets and objectives where concepts and ideas need to be sold to others
* Negotiates agreements and contracts and has the mandate/authority to sign them, slightly changing T\&Cs
* Initiates cross\-Managed Assigned North America Sector activities to improve efficiency and effectiveness of IT services
* Approves all major BU IT projects including integration projects at the regional level
* Oversees the delivery of agreed programs and projects within time, cost and quality constraints, within the BU
* Recruits and develops the members of the BU’s IT leadership team; keeps them motivated and oversees their project and priority assignments
* Approves key personnel decisions for the BU IT function
* Generates commitment, motivation and enthusiasm for the company, division and BU
* Leads and manages team; determines team structure, roles and performance targets in co\-operation with general management
* Evaluates performance and proposes performance\-based compensation for direct reports


**Required Education And Experience**
* Minimum 10 years of relevant experience in IT functions with leadership responsibility
* Minimum 10 years of relevant supply chain, 3PL, logistics experience in IT functions with leadership responsibility
* Manages and leads teams through expertise in all areas of the IT function


 Our organization has a business casual environment and focuses on teamwork, associate development, training, and continuous improvement. We offer competitive wages, excellent affordable insurance benefits (including health, dental, vision and life), 401K plan, paid vacation and holidays.
   

  

 Our organization is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Head of IT
description:
Action1 is an autonomous endpoint management platform that is cloud\-native, infinitely scalable, highly secure, and configurable in 5 minutes—it just works and is always free for the first 200 endpoints, with no functional limits. By pioneering autonomous OS and third\-party patching \- AEM’s foundational use case \- through peer\-to\-peer patch distribution and real\-time vulnerability assessment without needing a VPN, it eliminates costly, time\-consuming routine labor, preempts ransomware and security risks, and protects the digital employee experience. Trusted by thousands of enterprises managing millions of endpoints globally, Action1 is certified for SOC 2 and ISO 27001\.
 



 The company is founder\-led by industry veterans Alex Vovk and Mike Walters, American entrepreneurs who founded Netwrix, which has grown into a multi\-billion\-dollar industry\-leading cybersecurity company.
 



  





**About the role:** 




 At Action1, we're looking for a
 **Head of IT** 
 — a true owner, not just a process coordinator. This role goes far beyond keeping the lights on. You will be responsible for building, scaling, and owning the entire internal IT landscape to support the rapid growth of our fully remote, global SaaS company. Your mission is to create an IT foundation that grows with us — secure, efficient, user\-friendly, and ready for the future.
 



  





**What you’ll do:** 



* Own and continuously evolve all internal IT operations, ensuring security, efficiency, and scalability.
* Architect, manage, and optimize IT infrastructure based on Microsoft 365 and a variety of corporate services.
* Design, implement, and improve IT onboarding, access management, and user support processes.
* Automate routine IT tasks using scripting and modern automation tools — simplify and scale operations without adding headcount.
* Take full ownership of IT compliance aspects, supporting SOC 2, ISO 27001, and other certifications that safeguard our business and customers.
* Partner with cross\-functional teams (HR, Finance, R\&D, etc.) to ensure seamless and scalable internal operations.
* Drive the IT user experience across the entire company, creating a secure, reliable, and employee\-friendly environment.
* Proactively identify, resolve, and prevent infrastructure and process bottlenecks.
* Build, maintain, and take pride in comprehensive IT documentation — workflows, procedures, knowledge base articles — everything that makes scaling painless.
* Foster a supportive and empathetic IT culture, ensuring employees of all technical backgrounds feel empowered and cared for.
* Build, lead, and expand a high\-performing IT team capable of supporting a global, distributed workforce — with the long\-term goal of ensuring 24/7 coverage for all Action1 employees worldwide.



  





**What we’re looking for:** 



* Proven experience as Head of IT, IT Team Lead, Senior IT Administrator, or a similar leadership role.
* Strong expertise in Microsoft 365, Azure AD, and endpoint management.
* Hands\-on skills in scripting and automation (Python, PowerShell, or similar) — you don’t need to be a software engineer, but you must be able to automate your own work and confidently maintain and enhance existing automation.
* Solid understanding of information security principles and best practices.
* Demonstrated ability to build and scale IT processes in a fast\-growing environment.
* Ability to work effectively with both technical and non\-technical teams.
* Core qualities: ownership, empathy, responsibility, and a passion for making technology accessible.
* Passion for clear, thorough, and well\-structured documentation.
* Exceptional written and spoken English, with the ability to communicate clearly and professionally in a U.S.\-based business environment.



  





**Nice to Have:** 



* Bonus points if you have experience with compliance frameworks such as SOC 2 and ISO 27001\.
* Experience with helpdesk systems and asset management platforms.
* Enjoy working in a culture where ownership, responsibility, and empathy matter more than hierarchy.



  





**What we offer:** 




  




* Fully remote work, providing the flexibility needed in today’s world.
* Opportunity to be part of a team dedicated to creating an environment where people can thrive.
* Collaborative environment that encourages creativity and innovation.
* Supportive colleagues committed to your professional growth.
* Comprehensive benefits package.



  





 If you are
 **passionate about IT infrastructure** 
 and eager to make a meaningful impact, we would love to hear from you!

title: IT Director
description:
LA (Lindeman \& Associates) launched in 2015 and quickly established itself as a leader in the entertainment advertising space, winning Clio’s Agency of the Year in 2017\. LA brings together artists, editors, and storytellers into one hyper\-collaborative team specializing in crafting iconic 360º campaigns. Our work grows audiences, sparks conversations, builds brands, and shapes culture. Though we hail from around the country—and the world—Los Angeles is our creative home and our muse. LA is honored to collaborate with the industry’s leading theatrical and streaming partners, including Disney, FX, HBOMAX, Amazon Studios, Hulu, Lionsgate, Netflix, STARZ, Universal Pictures, and Warner Bros.
   

  

 LA is seeking an innovative Director of IT, responsible for overseeing the agency’s IT infrastructure and leading the broader IT team. This individual plays a critical role in ensuring the smooth operation of agency IT systems, security protocols and audit compliance. The Director of IT will collaborate closely with the leadership team to support business operations and ensure that technology solutions are aligned with company goals. This role reports to the agency’s Managing Director.
   

  

 This position is a hybrid role that involves both leadership and hands\-on management of IT systems.
 **We are looking for someone who embraces AI; this role will have a significant focus on AI adoption, particularly as it relates to infrastructure and security.**
 What You'll Do
   

  

 Leadership \& Team Management
   

  

* Lead and manage the IT team to ensure high performance and alignment with company goals
* Provide clear expectations to direct reports to ensure accountability vis\-a\-vis job responsibilities
* Supervises/Team Structure:
* Senior Systems Administrator
* Senior Systems Administrator
* Systems Administrator
* Desktop Support Technician II
* Vault Coordinator and Runner Supervisor
* Archivist and Data Librarian


 Security \& IT Protocols
   

  

* Develop, implement, and monitor security protocols to ensure the protection of company data and compliance with industry standards
* Oversee and ensure the agency is prepared to pass all client audits related to IT infrastructure and operations


 IT Operations
   

  

* Oversee the daily operations of IT systems, including hardware, software and cloud services, ensuring optimal performance
* Ensure contingency plans are in place to address any/all IT emergencies and that the IT team is trained on implementation
* Work within the context of the IT budget to ensure redundancy across as many systems as possible


 Collaboration
   

  

* Work closely with other department heads, including the Director of AI, to support business initiatives and technological needs
* Proactively seek out and keep department heads abreast of the latest technological developments and advancements in an effort to enhance operational efficiencies


 Budget Management
   

  

* Manage the IT department budget, making recommendations for resource allocation, tools and equipment
* Ensure proper lead time is provided for leadership to consider large\-scale IT purchases


 Research \& Development
   

  

* Stay up to date on the latest hardware and software solutions, especially as it pertains to the entertainment industry, so that the agency stays at the forefront of technological change
* Train departmental and agency staff as needed to harness the capabilities of the latest technological innovations


 What We’re Looking For
   

  

* Proven experience in IT management and team leadership, with a strong focus on security protocols and audit compliance
* Expertise in IT systems, cloud computing, and security protocols
* A familiarity and interest in one or more of the following (or other) AI tools (Midjourney, Reve; Ideogram; Stable Diffusion, etc)
* Tech Knowledge:
+ Windows servers with Active Directory
+ Jamf Pro computer management
+ Google Workspace Enterprise
+ Sophos Security \- Firewalls, AV, VPN
+ Brocade and UniFi switches and Access Points
+ Some servers and RAIDs are Linux\-based
+ Workstations are 95% Mac, 5% PC
+ Adobe Creative Cloud

* Strategic Communication \& Business Continuity Planning: must be able to communicate effectively with both technical and non\-technical stakeholders, including agency partners and leadership. This includes translating complex systems or concepts in a way that is clear, actionable, and aligned with business goals
* The role also requires a strategic mindset, with the ability to propose and implement business continuity plans that reflect cost considerations and operational priorities
* Effective Communication: Ability to clearly articulate large\-scale IT initiatives, ensuring the team and broader company are aligned with project goals and progress. This includes proactively sharing updates, challenges, and solutions with relevant stakeholders, fostering transparency, and promoting team engagement
* Problem\-Solving \& Solution\-Oriented Mindset: Strong ability to not only identify issues but also take the lead in developing and presenting actionable solutions to the team and leadership
* Expected to bring solutions to the table when challenges arise, ensuring timely and effective resolution of IT\-related matters


 The Perks
   

  

 We want to make sure you’re taken care of while we build the future of entertainment together. LA is proud to offer a comprehensive benefits package to our team alongside competitive compensation.
   

  

* The base compensation range for this position in the selected city is $120,000\-170,000 annually. Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including but not limited to the candidate's qualifications, location, prior experience, and education
* Work is hybrid: Flexible work environment, with the ability to work remotely and in\-office as needed for team collaboration and on\-site support. Office located in Downtown Los Angeles Arts District. Data center located in El Segundo
* Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, FSA’s
* Short and long\-term disability, accident, critical\-care coverage
* PTO and paid holidays
* 401K plan
* Certain roles may be eligible for an annual discretionary bonus
* Employee wellness benefits and mental health support
* Employee engagement gatherings
* Work with world\-class talent in an environment that promotes creative freedom on projects you’ll be proud to tell your family and friends about


 Physical Demands:
   

  

 The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
   

  

 Extended periods of desk work:
   

  

* The role necessitates prolonged periods of sitting, engaging in tasks that require hands/fingers for typing, writing, and handling small tools or equipment


 Communication:
   

  

* Effective communication is pivotal in this position, requiring regular verbal exchanges during team meetings, client interactions, and while providing guidance to IT employees and cross\-departmental teams


 Visual acuity:
   

  

* Must be able to read and interpret data on screens and printed documents; may involve prolonged viewing of computer monitors


 Utilization of technology:
   

  

* Proficiency with various computer software and tools,as mentioned in the job description, including, but not limited to Adobe Creative Suite, Keynote, and project management platforms (e.g., Wrike). This entails precise manual dexterity and adept eye\-hand coordination


 Mobility
   

  

* Occasional walking, standing, and movement within an office environment and between departments


 LA is an equal opportunity employer. We're committed to making LA as inclusive and diverse as the audience we engage with every day. LA is dedicated to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodation, please contact careers@lassociates.com.
